data.title: Sub-lesson 101A: Greetings (formal vs casual)
data.text: Khmer greetings have formal and casual options. Use formal greetings in respectful or service contexts, and casual greetings with friends or people you know.

data.front: សុខសប្បាយទេ?

data.question: Which phrase is the formal greeting?
data.explanation: «ជំរាបសួរ» is a formal hello. «សួស្តី» is casual, and «ជំរាបលា/លា» are goodbyes.

data.title: Sub-lesson 101B: Politeness essentials (replies + thanks)
data.text: These phrases make your Khmer sound friendly and respectful. Khmer also uses gendered polite reply particles for “yes.”
data.culture_note: In Cambodia, it is common to add polite particles in replies: «ចាស» (female) and «បាទ» (male). Using them with older people, staff, or in formal situations sounds respectful.

data.hint: Find «ណ» at the end: អ-រ-គុ-ណ. It is the final character in the word.

data.question: Choose the polite “yes” used by a woman:
data.explanation: «ចាស» is commonly used by women as a polite “yes.” «បាទ» is the male variant.
